qas.question: What does corruption undermine in politics?
What does corruption disregard in politics?
Political corruption in legislature reduces what, overall?
Corruption in what compromises the rule of law?
Corruption in what creates weak provision of services?

context: In politics, corruption undermines <a0_0>democracy<a0_0/> and good governance by flouting or even subverting <a1_0>formal processes<a1_0/>. Corruption in elections and in the legislature reduces <a2_0>accountability<a2_0/> and distorts representation in policymaking; corruption in the <a3_0>judiciary<a3_0/> compromises the rule of law; and corruption in <a4_0>public administration<a4_0/> results in the inefficient provision of services. It violates a basic principle of republicanism regarding the centrality of civic virtue.
